name: MusicOptionsHelper
description: The MusicOptionsHelper class provides comprehensive control over all audio and sound settings in Minecraft. This helper allows scripters to manage volume levels for different sound categories, control audio devices, and configure subtitle settings.
overview:
The MusicOptionsHelper class manages all audio-related settings including:
- Volume control for different sound categories (master, music, blocks, mobs, etc.)
- Audio device selection and management
- Subtitle display configuration
- Sound category-specific volume adjustments
- Real-time audio settings modification

methods.name: getParent
methods.description: Returns the parent OptionsHelper instance.

methods.name: getMasterVolume
methods.description: Returns the current master volume level.

methods.name: setMasterVolume
methods.description: Sets the master volume level.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new master volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

methods.name: getMusicVolume
methods.description: Returns the current music volume level.

methods.name: setMusicVolume
methods.description: Sets the music volume level.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new music volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setMusicVolume(0.5); // Set music to 50%

methods.name: getRecordsVolume
methods.description: Returns the current volume for playing records (jukebox music).

methods.name: setRecordsVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for playing records.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new records volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setRecordsVolume(0.8); // Set records to 80%

methods.name: getWeatherVolume
methods.description: Returns the current volume for weather sounds (rain, thunder).

methods.name: setWeatherVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for weather sounds.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new weather volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setWeatherVolume(0.6); // Set weather to 60%

methods.name: getBlocksVolume
methods.description: Returns the current volume for block-related sounds.

methods.name: setBlocksVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for block sounds.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new blocks volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setBlocksVolume(0.7); // Set blocks to 70%

methods.name: getHostileVolume
methods.description: Returns the current volume for hostile mob sounds.

methods.name: setHostileVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for hostile mob sounds.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new hostile mobs volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setHostileVolume(0.9); // Set hostile mobs to 90%

methods.name: getNeutralVolume
methods.description: Returns the current volume for neutral mob sounds.

methods.name: setNeutralVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for neutral mob sounds.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new neutral mobs volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setNeutralVolume(0.8); // Set neutral mobs to 80%

methods.name: getPlayerVolume
methods.description: Returns the current player volume (footsteps, eating, etc.).

methods.name: setPlayerVolume
methods.description: Sets the player volume.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new player volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setPlayerVolume(0.85); // Set player sounds to 85%

methods.name: getAmbientVolume
methods.description: Returns the current ambient volume.

methods.name: setAmbientVolume
methods.description: Sets the ambient volume.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new ambient volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setAmbientVolume(0.4); // Set ambient to 40%

methods.name: getVoiceVolume
methods.description: Returns the current voice volume.

methods.name: setVoiceVolume
methods.description: Sets the voice volume.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The new voice volume value (0.0 to 1.0)

examples:
const musicOptions = Client.getGameOptions().music;
musicOptions.setVoiceVolume(0.7); // Set voice to 70%

methods.name: getVolume
methods.description: Gets the volume for a specific sound category.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The sound category name (see Sound Categories Reference)

methods.name: getVolumes
methods.description: Returns a map of all sound categories and their volumes.

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume for a specific sound category.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The sound category name (see Sound Categories Reference)

methods.name: getSoundDevice
methods.description: Returns the currently selected audio device.

methods.name: setSoundDevice
methods.description: Sets the audio device to use.

parameters.name: audioDevice
parameters.description: The audio device name to use

methods.name: getAudioDevices
methods.description: Returns a list of all connected audio devices.

methods.name: areSubtitlesShown
methods.description: Checks if subtitles are enabled.

methods.name: showSubtitles
methods.description: Enables or disables subtitles.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: Whether to show subtitles or not
